transcripts.text: Hi folks, I'm Steve Hindy for Showing Animals Respect and Kindness.  We have a barn burner of an update in the case of R.A.  Strickland, the indicted and suspended sheriff of Colleton County, South Carolina.  You may recall that Strickland is a friend and protector of the Broxton Bridge Plantation, also located in Colleton County.  Broxton Bridge Plantation holds cruel, wasteful live pigeon shoots for psychopaths who can't be bothered with real hunting and hunting ethics, such as fair chase and eating what you kill.  These sick people involved children in their massacres, and Sheriff Strickland, when provided with overwhelming evidence of abuse to both animals and children at the hands of the psychos, chose to stand with the psychos.  In fact, Strickland is on a first-name basis with Broxton owner Jerry Barn, who calls him Andy.  I thought Andy told me he differed, that that was something that he could make him move for.  Back in November 2019, we reported that Sheriff Strickland had been arrested for domestic abuse after he reportedly...

Strickland punched a member of his household in the face several times around 10 p.m.  Thursday, then took their cell phone, preventing her from calling 911, according to an arrest warrant affidavit filed by the state law enforcement division.

The classic narcissist, Strickland's response to the charges against him was that he needed time to heal.  You know, folks, we can't make this stuff up.  And if you think the crazy train has arrived at its destination, well, I'm afraid it's just getting warmed up.  On February 13, 2020, Colleton County Sheriff R.A.  Strickland was indicted on 15 counts of malfeasance.  According to NBC affiliate WSAV, the indictment filed on Thursday accuses Strickland of the following.

Six counts of misconduct in office.  two counts of use of official position or office for financial gain, three counts of embezzlement, one count of use of public funds, property, or time to influence election, one count of distribution of a Schedule II controlled substance.

Sheriff Strickland reportedly had deputies and staff working on improvements to his home, land, and other properties or businesses Strickland was involved in while on duty for the Colleton County Sheriff's Office.  The indictment states he also had staff spend regular work hours working on his reelection campaign.  According to the state newspaper, Strickland is accused of using his supervisory power over the employment and wages of the sheriff's office staff.
This particular account has to do with his relationship
and an ongoing sexual relationship that he had with that subordinate and alleges that he used his official position, his official power, his ability

control the employment of that subordinate and others the ability of his office to control the wages of that subordinate and others, to coerce that individual into continuing an ongoing sexual relationship.

According to prosecutor Crichton Waters, Strickland also took an employee to a conference in Myrtle Beach for no legitimate reason.  He was only going there to pursue an extramarital affair with the subordinate.  While there, Strickland gave the young employee, who was under 21, alcohol and Ambien.  Ambien is a prescription sedative that is illegal to use without a doctor's okay, and it is not to be used with alcohol.  Charges also include giving a $3,000 government radio with secure first responder communications channels to a citizen with no valid official purpose.  The damning information just goes on and on, and we'll include a number of links in the description section of this video.  Shark regularly calls out people involved in animal cruelty, whether directly or by way of protecting those who are committing the abuse.  Those who abuse animals or corruptly protect those who abuse animals will tend to also abuse people, as Strickland did, and to commit other corrupt acts.  R.A.  Strickland, Andy, is just our latest example.  We'll continue to watch Andy Strickland's case and keep you informed.  I'm Steve Hindy for Showing Animals Respect and Kindness.

Thank you for watching.  Please like and share this video.  You can subscribe to our channel to see more of our investigations and learn what you can do to help Shark help animals.  To support Shark directly and gain access to exclusive content, consider sponsoring us on Patreon.
